author: Andrew Mitchell
comment: Very informative with lots of football videos that are fun to watch on the go. If choosing between this and BBC sport, I would have both. BBC sport is great for all round sports, including tennis and rugby and onefootball is better for football. However, for championship teams, not all players are registered and have a profile-something which would be a nice upgrade for the lower league supporters. Overall, a great app for viewing football anywhere and a good time killer for long journeys. Very informative and fun to use. For premier league fans, it probably is a 5-Star as the main focus is on that league.

author: jesus martinez
comment: Excellent app. Love the following option and favorite teams. Still surprises me when it tells me there's a gol in my favorites' games and I don't even know they were supposed to be playing!. I didn't give it five stars because there must be some room for improvement like live updates with videos.  Thank you for the good work

This app is great for getting the latest football news quickly. They're are no annoying adds popping up and it will always give you he run down of everything to do with football. You can choose what team you support and others you want to follow. It will give you match statistics and facts before the match has even started. And also every time a goal is scored it will give you a notification in that game of your favored team you chose. Very helpful and informative and I have had it for about a year and a half now. BRILLIANT...

author: robert bell
comment: It has everything you can ask for, team news, updates, stats on every single player its just a great app all around. One thing i wish they did was have info as to what channel games were on. But other than that great app

author: Ben Martin
comment: The best football app I have ever used. Gives very quick up to date scores for every match. You can find a wide range of leagues as well as their teams and players. Everything about it is amazing but there is one player who is wrong. Which is Fulham's Ryan Sessegnon, but in the app it says Steven Sessegnon and when I check other social media platforms froms or go on the internet to check Fulham's number 3, it says Ryan and not Steven which it says on the app. Please could you look into this and change it!

author: Namit Sakkarwal
comment: Always network error, when a match start it shows match didnt start &now dont show league stats. This app is now  worse. Have to uninstall this app. Dont know how this app still got better rating.

author: VOIR BVX
comment: Better than Goal, which really is its only serious competitor on the Play Store. Also my hair grew back within weeks, my libido is like it was freshman year of college, and my meatstick grew 11 inches, around. (think about that) Thanks Onefootball!!!

author: Daniel Wyman
comment: Generally a very informative, helpful and up to date app. In-game stats are really excellent and easy to understand. I have noticed that over turned decisions, when VAR gets involved, are not immediately translated into this app but VAR is a learning curve for everyone involved.   The reason for only 4*: Misleading notifications. Often they are just lies to get me to open the app. Some times I have already read an article and later there is a notification relating to that article which is misleading at best. I think it is unnecessary for an app so brilliant as this, to resort to tabloid click bait tactics.

author: Vern Wilcox
comment: Has always worked great... until now, since the latest update, the app refuses to connect to net, always tells me the is no network connection, even though everything else is connected to the net and working well

author: Kraig Wilson
comment: Great app! Can't fault it. But you need to hold back on the 'rumours' factor, there's so many and it gets tiresome.

author: Lauren M
comment: This app always has reliable information and it's my favorite source for scores, news, and schedules. However, and I know this isn't important to most users, I would greatly appreciate it if they would add the NWSL.

author: Shahen Sayadian
comment: I use this app more than anything else on my phone to check live scoring , schedule games, and latest updated news for my favorite  team, and all others, thanks for the great job you done and keep up the good work.

author: Paisley Face
comment: Way too many alerts for one day. Appreciate the content but fed up of my phone beeping every 2 minutes

author: Leigh Nathan Joseph
comment: This app is just getting slow and unresponsive. Please attend to this as this used to be my go to app for Football updates. Might have to change now, with this slow and unresponsive new format. Thanks

author: rivan kazo
comment: Very nice UI and good ides including news articles. One thing I'll note is that the selection of leagues and competitions available could be better and wider. Other apps include a lot more leagues from areas like the Middle East, Africa, and Central and East Asia. No doubt you have many users from countries whose leagues aren't included, so I think that might be a nice addition. Also one thing I noticed is that some teams still have old badges rather their new ones, only one I noticed so far is Sydney FC but I'm sure there are more examples. If the dev team are having trouble keeping their app up to date, then I'm sure the userbase would love to help with that! :)

author: Stephen Grice
comment: Best footie app I've used. Better than Sky and BBC. Always seems to be the fastest with 'breaking news' on your favourite team and I love the refs whistle when the match starts and finishes and the roar of the crowd when your team scores ia a great touch. Recommended 👍
I m not recieving notifications anymore  i tried everything but no notifications are being recieved or even sent please fix this issue

author: gmoreno18
comment: You're making a great app slow, heavy and unresponsive. I am personally not enjoying my interactions with this app anymore as it takes time and patience to check the info that you want.

author: LIL_LEARNER BOY
comment: Its the best soccer app i i missed a red bull salzburg game and it gave me notifications  I recommend you should use it
Great for football fans. All the latest news from all sources. You can follow your favourite team and players look at all the stats. Just a great app for the fan to keep ahead of the breaking news.

author: Taha Marabani
comment: Great app, loving it. At first, I found it confusing trying to find the table but you get used to it. Overall a fantastic app

author: Sean Markey
comment: Pretty poor in all honesty. Does not clearly show a timer, of how far it is, in any given match. If there is, it's completely hidden.

author: Naveed Ali
comment: I like every thing about this app. The radio every thing but if it give me live match coverage in pakistan it would be great...

author: Muhanad abdelrahim
comment: Use it n you wouldn't think of an alternative. Instantly update event changes. Quick results tracking. Easy to navigate and organize. Better yet adds are well laid out so it wouldn't bother much. If only the add local soprts channel that would air the game you read about.

author: Tapiwa Nyakabau
comment: Simply the best app for any football, news,  opinions and football rumours. Also the app is tied with some great football blogs and outlets, such as Tifo football etc. All in all a must download!

author: Fox Maikovich
comment: The app is smooth to use and does a great job at displaying the fixtures and other information. I really enjoy seeing the club crests on the fixture screen as I find it easier to find games by the crests, rather than just the team names. Unfortunately the reason that I am writing this review is the infuriating click-bait titles that the app uses for it's notifications. The articles they offer provide great information but PLEASE just put the real article title in the notifications. For example, Onefootball had an article detailing Neymar's need to have surgery. Instead of pushing the real article title in the notification they instead wrote "Brazilian star" needs surgery. Today the notification said $42 million Atleti striker instead of just saying Jackson Martinez. The notifications for the articles will never use the players real names instead opting to be incredibly vauge to bait you into opening the app. At first this wasn't a huge deal, but over time this has become incredibly annoying especially when the articles are pretty short. In the end, the Sofa Score app is just better at pretty much everything. The UI may be a bit clunky and not as clean, but it has much more information than this app.

author: Sean Tucker
comment: Decided to update my review as it was 4 yrs ago since I last submitted it. All I can say is its a much improved App from those early days. Well done guys for turning this app into an absolute must have for any footy fan. Informative, fast and reliable, what else do you need!

author: Lion Works
comment: It really helps me when I am not at a game and trying to figure out who and when they scored. Its really good at guessing the line up and it has cool reports of thing that are hapening in the footballing world

author: Akash Kumar
comment: Why this app is showing wrong information? In champions league tab Ronaldo is highest goal scorer but according to you people Ben Tedder have the most goals.

author: Tarik Kadhim
comment: What part of 'turn off notifications' isn't clear. Following a competition is not the same as asking for notifications. Then getting an unwanted notification stating that it is a crazy fa cup round after Man Utd are winning 2-0 doesn't sound too crazy to me.

author: Renato Corte
comment: Euro 2016 podcast on the semi finals started with an introduction of "the 3 superpowers and.. hmm.. Portugal".. joke or no joke, for a news-type podcast on the tournament hosted by a British commentator , it's a disastrous way to show  unprofessional conduct..

author: Kshitiz Panday
comment: Thabk god they went back to "following" and "all news" format! Hated the change but all is good now.

Das Handy ist auf Englisch. Man möchte die App aber gerne auf deutsch haben . Entweder ist der Weg zu kompliziert es umstellen zu können oder man möchte es einfach nicht und legt kein Wert auf die User Einstellungen.

author: alessio luinetti
comment: All the games live u want + news and can silence notifications u don't want. Great app.

author: Evelyn Figueroa
comment: This is a great app for the futbol (soccer) fan. I can follow all of my favorite leagues from la liga, and premier league to the mls, all in one place. It also contains up to date news and videos. I give it 👍👍 up.

author: Tarun Rajaratnam
comment: An excellent app....have you toyed with the idea of providing highlights of matches....or you can start a collection of best goals every week......the app has a high potential....if we are talking about extremities...you can even provide streaming links to watch the matches....ponder upon these suggestions...

author: Eric Villeda
comment: Best football app I've ever had. Only problem is it crashes sometimes but overall excellent app

author: NIGERIANGAMERS
comment: B.S app.  Takes too long to load with my fast internet (I watch YouTube all the time) and glitches (A LOT)

author: SANJOY PAUL
comment: Why everytime app crashes when I enter to any external website article on this app... If those link will cause crashes of the app then why to show those cards on this app?

author: amita kumari
comment: It is very good app All news of football are available there is just one draw back sometime players are said of being of their original club even after transfer
